name: 技職教育評鑑專題研究
goals: To understand the history of program evaluation, current issues and future trends.
To explore the general nature of program evaluation (e.g. definitions, models, standards, types of evaluation, examples of evaluation research, etc.)
To be familiar with the practice of program evaluation (e.g. guidelines for planning, conducting and using evaluation & the design and implementation of program evaluation)
To possess the ability to plan a program evaluation and to generate a critique.
syllabus:
Teaching schedule (may be adjusted due to the real teaching condition)

1\. Introduction to program evaluation  
2\. Nature of the Evaluation Program, Evaluation and Research  
3\. History of Program Evaluation  
4\. Types of Evaluation  
  --Accreditation  
  --Accountability  
  --Legislation  
  --Personnel  
  --Program  
  --Needs Assessment  
5\. Traditional Evaluation Models  
  --Tyler  
  --Kirkpatrick  
  --Cronbach  
  --Scriven  
  --Stake  
  --Stufflebeam  
6\. Alternative Approaches to Program Evaluation  
  --Objective-Oriented  
  --Management-Oriented  
  --Consumer-Oriented  
7\. Alternative Approaches to Program Evaluation  
  --Expertise-Oriented  
  --Participant-Oriented  
  --Summary and Comparative Analysis  
8\. Scenario discussion & Mid-term presentation  
9\. Evaluation Standards  
  --Introduction  
  --Applying the Standards  
  --Utility Standards  
  --Feasibility Standards  
  --Propriety Standards  
  --Accuracy Standards  
10\. Planning Evaluation  
  --Defining Evaluation Purposes and Responsibilities  
  --Understanding Evaluation Context  
  --Identifying and Selecting the Evaluation Questions and Criteria  
11\. Planning and Conducting Evaluation  
  --Evaluation Method Plan  
  --Evaluation Management Plan  
  --Design, Sampling, and Cost Choice  
  --Data Collection, Analysis and Interpretation  
12\. Evaluation Reports  
  --Evaluation Use  
  --Dealing with Political, Ethical, and Interpersonal Aspects of Evaluation  
  --Meta-evaluation  
13\. Conducting Multiple-Site Evaluation  
  --Evaluation in the Nonprofit Sector  
  --Evaluating Corporate Training Programs  
14\. Trends/Issues in Program Evaluation  
15\. Final Project Presentation / Discussion 1  
16\. Final Project Presentation / Discussion 2

grading.note: Weekly Journal Entries/assignment, providing review and critique for entries or assignment of pointed topics and articles weekly.
Participation in class activities and discussion. Engagement and contribution for groups activities.
Individual study’s presentation and final paper.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
